questions.question_text: Which Terraform command checks that your configuration syntax is correct?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer is B. terraform validate

Selected Answer: B
Answer is obviously false

Selected Answer: B
B Validate command doesn't talk to providers

Selected Answer: B
The terraform validate command validates the configuration files in a directory, referring only to the configuration and NOT accessing any remote services such as remote state, provider APIs, etc.

questions.question_text: terraform validate uses provider APIs to verify your infrastructure settings.

choices.D: Terraform needs to install the necessary plugins first
choices.A: Terraform needs you to format your code according to best practices first
choices.B: Terraform requires you to manually run terraform plan first
choices.C: The Terraform CLI needs you to log into Terraform Cloud first

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
When you add a new provider to your Terraform configuration and immediately run `terraform apply`, the operation fails because Terraform requires the provider plugins to be installed before any actions can be performed. This is done during the `terraform init` stage, which downloads and installs the necessary provider binaries from the registry or other source

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D

questions.question_text: You add a new provider to your configuration and immediately run terraform apply in the CLI using the local backend. Why does the apply fail?

choices.A: They can securely store cloud credentials
choices.C: You must use the CLI to switch between workspaces
choices.D: Plans and applies can be triggered via version control system integrations

questions.question_text: Which of these statements about Terraform Cloud workspaces is false?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
it has GUI no need must use CLI

C. You must use the CLI to switch between workspaces

In Terraform Cloud, you don't necessarily need to use the CLI to switch between workspaces. Instead, you can manage workspaces through the Terraform Cloud web interface or programmatically using the Terraform Cloud API.

Selected Answer: C
C for sure

Selected Answer: A
A. The ability to restrict modules to members of Terraform Cloud or Enterprise organizations
Correct: This is a key value of the Terraform Cloud private registry. It allows organizations to control access to their modules, ensuring that only authorized members within the organization can use them. This is particularly important for enterprises that need to manage permissions and maintain security and compliance standards.

choices.D: The ability to share modules with public Terraform users and members of Terraform Cloud Organizations
choices.A: The ability to restrict modules to members of Terraform Cloud or Enterprise organizations
choices.B: The ability to share modules publicly with any user of Terraform
choices.C: The ability to tag modules by version or release
